questionListItems.title: What is the cut-off point for your school?
I would like to apply for Financial Assistant Scheme (FAS) now, how should I apply?

answer.body: Please visit this webpage for more details: Financial Assistance Scheme

questionListItems.title:
I have yet to receive any news of my FAS approval, should I proceed to purchase the books and
uniform first?

answer.body:
No. Do not purchase the books until the FAS approval is given otherwise school will not be able to
refund money for your purchase. Please do not buy the books until you have received the FAS Approval
Letter.

questionListItems.title:
If I have applied for MOE FAS in my primary school, why am I not contacted by Yuan Ching Sec to
collect my textbooks and uniform?

answer.body:
The school will call the parents to arrange an appointment from 23 to 30 Dec 2022 for the collection of
the textbooks and uniform. Please bring along the Letter of Approval from the Primary School for
verification on the arranged date. However, if the school has not contacted you by 28 Dec 2022, please
contact the school to enquire.

questionListItems.title: Can I purchase my own device for my child to use in school?

answer.body:
The school is using the Apple iPad (9 th Generation) for teaching and learning. If you would like to use

your own device rather than purchased through the school’s bulk tender, please ensure the device is

an Apple iPad which meet the following requirements:

- device should not be older than 4 years from manufacturing date

- battery should hold charge for at least 4 hours;

- comparable form factor to school’s bulk tender devices (e.g. touchscreen, physical keyboard,

Apple Pencil);

- comparable performance to school’s bulk tender devices

i. Processor: A10 Fusion or better

ii. Capacity: 32 GB or higher

iii. OS version: iPadOS14 or higher

iv. Screen Size: 10.0 to 11.9 inch (diagonal)

v. Resolution: 2048 x 1536 or higher resolution

vi. Wi-fi function should work and support at least IEEE 802.11 a/n/ac standard that uses

5GHz.

Your child is required to bring the device to school for assessment of suitability of device to

function as Personal Learning Device.

Once assessed as suitable, the school will install the DMA (Device Management Application) to

provide a safe learning experience and prevent misuse of the device.

questionListItems.title: Can students keep the iPad after graduation?

answer.body:
Yes, students can keep their iPad. The DMA will be uninstalled from the device when the child
graduates/leaves the school.

questionListItems.title: What if my child’s iPad screen cracked as he/she has accidentally drop it?

answer.body:
Your child may inform your Form Teacher and the ICT Manager – Mdm Anniah – on the issue.

Do take a photograph of your claim e.g. screen crack

For this Accidental damage, you may either

- claim insurance from AsiaPac. You can only claim once, and the current insurance coverage is 3

years.

- You may get the claim insurance from ICT Manager and fill up the relevant highlighted sections.

The vendor will do a fortnight collection of the device. This process usually takes 6-8 weeks for

the replacement.

Or

go straight to any Apple Service Centre below. This is especially when you have utilized the claim

insurance from AsiaPac. Otherwise, this process is usually faster and you may use Apple Care to

pay only the service fee. For the 2 nd option, your child will bring the new iPad to ICT Manager for

the school to install DMA in the device.

questionListItems.title: What if the Apple iPad is misplaced, stolen, or lost?

answer.body:
Do report to the form teacher and the ICT Manager. The school will ‘lock’ the device temporarily

until the device is found.

If it can’t be found within a week, police report will need to be made and submitted to the

school.

The school will need to raise a new order for new device for the student. Do check with the staff

in school’s General Office if you have sufficient amount in Edusave (for Singapore Citizen

students).

questionListItems.title: What if the Apple Pencil is faulty?

answer.body:
You may go to any of the Apple Service Centre for assessment and diagnosis. There will be a
service fee for Apple Pencil under accidental damage protection.
You may also purchase a replacement at your own cost.

questionListItems.title: What if the iPad Keyboard is faulty?

answer.body:
You may bring the keyboard to the ICT Manager for assessment. If it is faulty, the school will
report to AsiaPac and the vendor will collect the faulty keyboard during the fortnight collection.

questionListItems.title: How do I change the DMA Parent Option?

answer.body:
You may submit your request to https://go.gov.sg/ycss-dma-parent-option .

Changes to DMA Option will take place on the last Friday of the month.
